questions.prompt: Slowly, over time, have your parents stopped saying your name and started calling you by generic names like "champ", "kiddo", "disappointment", or "buddy"?

options.A: They usually say my name two to five times every sentence to make sure they don't forget it.
options.B: When I call, they tell me to 'hold on, I need to check your birth certificate.'
options.C: They usually ask me if I'm calling the wrong number.

questions.prompt: When was the last time your parents expressed disappointment in you?

options.A: Never. I am a paradigm of human excellence.
options.B: The third time they caught me in a compromising position with a peach.
options.D: When I called them over the phone sobbing, telling them that I miss them and wish they were a larger presence in my life.

questions.prompt: How much of your childhood trauma stems specifically from the way your parents raised you?

options.A: T-trauma? Who has that? Ha. Hahahahahahahahah-
options.D: I was raised as an upstanding, moral individual thanks to the occasional spanking.

questions.prompt: Do you often dream of your mother giving you a nice, warm sponge bath, as if your brain is craving maternal comfort?

options.B: No, I do not dream because I cannot fall asleep at night because I worry that my parents hate me.
options.D: I'm allergic to sponges, so this is not a dream, but a nightmare.

questions.prompt: If you do not call your parents, will they ever call you?
